citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of two new methane-producing cocci: Methanogenium olentangyi sp. nov., and Methanococcus deltae, sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Methanogenium olentangyi sp. nov., Corder et al.
Methanogenium olentangyi (o.len.tan.gy.i M.L. gen. n. olentangyi of the Olentangy (River))
Morphology: Irregular cocci, cell diameter 1.0-1.5 μm.
Cell wall sensitive to 0.001% SDS and distilled water.
Colonial morphology: Circular, mucoid, yellow, shiny, and convex.
Source: Freshwater sediment, Olentangy River, Ohio.
Physiology: Strict anaerobe, CO2 and H2 serve as substrates for growth and methane production.
Formate, methanol, and methylamine not metabolized.
Trypticase, yeast extract, vitamins not required.
Serology: Cross-reacts strongly (4+) with Methanobrevibacter smithii ALI antiserum.
The description of the type strain is the same as for the species.
